workflow.name: Auto-post YouTube Shorts from Google Drive with OpenRouter AI titles & descriptions
workflow.description:
## How it works

This workflow automatically uploads YouTube Shorts from a Google Drive folder.
It picks one video at each run, generates a YouTube-optimized title, description, and hashtags using an AI model, uploads the video through YouTube‚Äôs resumable upload API, and finally moves the processed video to a ‚ÄúPosted‚Äù folder.

## Key steps

Run on a schedule (daily/hourly/custom CRON)

Fetch one video from a selected Google Drive folder

Generate title + description + hashtags using an LLM

Prepare YouTube metadata

Upload the video via resumable upload

Move the file to a ‚Äúposted‚Äù folder to avoid duplicates

## Setup instructions

Connect your Google Drive credentials

Connect your YouTube OAuth2 credentials

Update the Drive folder IDs (input + posted folders)

Edit the ‚ÄúSet variables‚Äù node to change store name, country, coupon code, and tone

Review the prompt in the AI node if you want to customize content style

All technical details are documented inside the sticky notes within the workflow.

workflow.name: Auto-post YouTube Shorts from Google Drive (with AI captions)

parameters.content:
## How it works
This workflow automates posting YouTube Shorts directly from a Google Drive folder. Each time it runs, it selects the next available video, generates a title, description, and hashtags using an AI model, prepares the YouTube metadata, uploads the file through YouTube‚Äôs resumable upload API, and finally moves the processed video to a ‚ÄúPosted‚Äù folder.  
The goal is to help creators keep a consistent publishing schedule without manual uploads or text generation.

## Setup steps
1. Connect your Google Drive and YouTube OAuth2 credentials.  
2. Replace the folder ID in the ‚ÄúGet next video‚Äù node with your own input folder.  
3. Replace the folder ID in the final ‚ÄúMove file‚Äù node with your posted/processed folder.  
4. Open the ‚ÄúSet variables‚Äù or prompt section to adjust store name, region, coupon code, or tone as needed.  
5. Review the LLM prompt if you want to customize the text style.  
6. Enable the schedule trigger with the time interval you prefer.  

Sticky notes in the flow briefly explain each section, but this main sticky gives you the high-level view required to get started quickly.

parameters.text:
=You are a professional digital marketing specialist and short-form content writer.

Your task is to generate high-conversion, SEO-optimized content for YouTube Shorts promoting an online shopping discount coupon.

=====================================
üìå INPUT VARIABLES (Injected from workflow)
=====================================
Store name: {{ $json.storeName }}
Target country/region: {{ $json.country }}
Discount code: {{ $json.couponCode }}
Tone style: {{ $json.tone }} (e.g., Saudi dialect, Arabic simplified, or English)
Links (optional):
- Website: {{ $json.website }}
- Instagram: {{ $json.instagram }}
- TikTok: {{ $json.tiktok }}

=====================================
üéØ WHAT YOU MUST GENERATE
=====================================
1. A catchy YouTube Shorts title (max 60 characters)
2. A concise, keyword-rich description
3. Focused hashtags suitable for the region + store

=====================================
üìå RULES
=====================================
- Make the title short, powerful, and optimized for search.
- Description must encourage immediate coupon use.
- Include strong keywords related to:
  - the store
  - the discount
  - regional search intent
- Add expressive shopping emojis (üéÅüî•üí∏üõí).
- Adapt tone based on the requested style.
- If links exist, include them neatly in the description.
- Keep hashtags relevant, not spammy.

=====================================
üìå OUTPUT FORMAT
=====================================
Output **only valid JSON** in this structure:

{
  "title": "...",
  "description": "...",
  "hashtags": ["...", "...", "..."]
}

=====================================
üìå EXAMPLE (Do NOT copy):
{
  "title": "ÿÆÿµŸÖ ÿ±ŸáŸäÿ® ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿ™ÿ≥ŸàŸÇŸÉ ÿßŸÑŸäŸàŸÖ! üéÅüî•",
  "description": "ÿßÿ≥ÿ™ÿÆÿØŸÖ ÿßŸÑŸÉŸàÿØ ÿßŸÑÿ¢ŸÜ ŸÇÿ®ŸÑ ÿßŸÜÿ™Ÿáÿßÿ° ÿßŸÑÿπÿ±ÿ∂! ÿ±Ÿàÿßÿ®ÿ∑ŸÜÿß ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ≥ŸÖŸäÿ© ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥ŸÅŸÑ üëá",
  "hashtags": ["#ÿÆÿµŸÖ", "#ÿ™ÿ≥ŸàŸÇ", "#ÿπÿ±Ÿàÿ∂"]
}

=====================================
Now generate the final JSON.

parameters.content:
## Pick next video
Runs on a schedule and fetches one video from the selected Google Drive folder.  
This section identifies the next file to process.

## Generate metadata
Uses an AI model to generate a title, description, and hashtags.  
A small code node cleans JSON and formats the output for YouTube.

## Upload to YouTube
Initializes a resumable upload, downloads the file, and streams it to YouTube in the required format.

## Move processed file
Moves the video to the ‚ÄúPosted‚Äù folder to avoid duplicates and confirm successful upload.

user.name: osama goda
user.bio:
Automation Engineer & Laravel Developer specialized in building AI-powered workflows and backend integrations.
I design end-to-end automation systems combining n8n, custom APIs, and scalable Laravel backends.

My focus is creating clean, modular, production-ready workflows for SaaS platforms, customer support systems, payment processing, and Telegram/WhatsApp bots.

I bridge the gap between automation tools and custom backend development to deliver real business value.
